avalancheActivity.highlights: Weak layers in the old snowpack can still be released in isolated cases. On very steep sunny slopes crampons are useful
avalancheActivity.comment:
The little fresh snow and small drift accumulations were deposited on a weak old snowpack especially on very steep shaded slopes. Some small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized avalanches are possible. In particular transitions into gullies and bowls where weaknesses exist in the old snowpack are unfavourable, caution is to be exercised on very steep slopes, and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack. Dry avalanches can be released by small loads. The avalanche prone locations are sometimes covered with new snow and are difficult to recognise.
Individual mostly small natural avalanches are possible, in particular on extreme slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Little snow will fall on Sunday. In some localities 5 to 10 cm of snow fell on Saturday above approximately 2000 m. In the Gran Paradiso Valley headlands the precipitations were slightly more intense as was the wind. The southeasterly wind has transported only a little snow.
As a consequence of highly fluctuating temperatures and solar radiation a crust formed on the surface, in particular on steep sunny slopes below approximately 2700 m. These conditions facilitated a strengthening of the near-surface layers in particular on sunny slopes.
Shady slopes: The snowpack is dry and has a loosely bonded surface. Weak layers exist in the old snowpack.
Snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2400 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitude a little snow is lying. At low and intermediate altitudes less snow than usual is lying.

tendency.highlights: The weather report and anticipated change in the avalanche danger are uncertain. We recommend that you consult the most recent avalanche bulletin.

avalancheActivity.highlights: The more recent wind slabs are rather small but can be released in isolated cases.
avalancheActivity.comment:
The little fresh snow and small drift accumulations were deposited on a weak old snowpack especially on very steep shaded slopes. These can be released even by a single winter sport participant, in particular at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example in particular in high Alpine regions.
Individual gliding avalanches can also be released in the night or in the morning, in particular on extremely steep grassy slopes below approximately 2700 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided as far as possible.
On very steep sunny slopes crampons are useful

snowpackStructure.comment:
Little snow fell on Saturday in some localities.
As a consequence of falling temperatures a crust formed on the surface. These conditions facilitated a strengthening of the near-surface layers in particular on sunny slopes, in particular below approximately 2700 m.
Shady slopes: The snowpack is dry and has a loosely bonded surface.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2400 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitude a little snow is lying.

tendency.highlights: The weather report and anticipated change in the avalanche danger are uncertain. We recommend that you consult the most recent avalanche bulletin.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Beware of numerous exposed rocks hidden by the little recent snow.
avalancheActivity.comment:
The little fresh snow and small drift accumulations were deposited on a weak layer of old snow, especially on the shaded slopes at medium and high altitudes.
Dry avalanches can in some places be released in the weakly bonded old snow by small loads, especially adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas, and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example, in particular on very steep slopes. These places are sometimes covered with new snow and are difficult to recognise.
Isolated small dry avalanches are possible. This applies in particular on extreme slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Little snow will fall on Sunday. In some localities 5 to 10 cm of snow, and up to 15 cm in some localities, fell on Saturday above approximately 2000 m. The southeasterly wind has transported only a little snow.
Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions a little snow is lying. Also on steep sunny slopes below approximately 2600 m a little snow is lying. Also at low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is now lying.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2200 m, depending on the infuence of the wind.
Weak layers exist in the old snowpack especially on shady slopes.
As a consequence of highly fluctuating temperatures and solar radiation a crust formed on the surface, in particular below approximately 2700 m on very steep sunny slopes.

tendency.highlights: The weather report and anticipated change in the avalanche danger are uncertain. We recommend that you consult the most recent avalanche bulletin.

regions.name: B - VALLI DI GRESSONEY, AYAS, CHAMPORCHER
